_items.title: What grade do I need to pass the module?
_items.body:
The pass grade for undergraduate modules is 40%
The pass grade for postgraduate modules is 50%
(Note that some modules will have pass/fail assessment elements and some specialist assessments may have higher pass grades, so always check with your module coordinator).

_items.title: What do I do if I am unhappy with the mark I receive for my assessment?
_items.body:
Firstly, contact the module coordinator or the person who marked your assessment to discuss your mark and feedback. They will explain why you received a particular grade.

If you feel there were extenuating circumstances that impacted your performance and these were not previously available at the Exam Board, you can follow the student appeals procedure.

If you feel that there were procedural irregularities associated with the assessment, you can follow the student appeals procedure.

_items.title: What will happen if I do not pass this module?
_items.body: If you fail a module, you will get two more attempts if you are studying an undergraduate course. If you are studying a postgraduate course, you will get one more attempt. Check with your module coordinator for revision support and for the re-sit schedule.

_items.title: What happens if I fail one element of the assessment?
_items.body:
If you fail an assessment, firstly don’t panic!

In some module instances and where there is more than one assessment element, (e.g. exam and coursework) an overall module mark will be calculated. If you failed one element at 35-39% (undergraduate) or 45-49% (postgraduate), but passed the other element, then you may still have passed the module overall. Check your status with your module coordinator.

However, if your grade was below 35% (Ug) or 45%(Pg), or the element was compulsory to pass the module, you will still get further attempts at the assessment. Check with your module coordinator for revision support and for the re-sit schedule.

Note that where the assessment strategy for a module is 100% coursework element, and the coursework is made up of several component tasks (like a portfolio of tasks), then if you fail one component (even below 35% Ug or 45% Pg) but pass the coursework overall, then you will have passed the module.

_items.title: I have passed my assessment, but I am not happy with my mark. Can I retake the assessment?
_items.body: Assessment retakes (re-sits) are typically only available if you happen to fail an exam or piece of coursework that would lead to you failing a module. If you achieve a minimum pass grade or above (40% or above for undergraduate or 50% or above at postgraduate) then that grade will be confirmed at Exam Board, and you will not have another opportunity to retake. Sometimes, a module will have more than one element of assessment. (see ‘What happens if I fail one element of the assessment’).
